utterances.translation: This family had a daughter.

utterances.transcript: sač̓icaʔap̓aƛquuč                       ʔuksnaʕaaɬ      ʕiniiƛ, ʔatquu        hawiɬšiƛšiʔiʔaaɬ           ʕiiɬčsnaʕaaɬ,     wawaaʔat    nananiqsak.
utterances.translation: She used to play with dogs all the time, although her grandparents said to her, “Stop playing with dogs all the time.”
She never listened.
She grew up, and still she played with dogs.
This girl got pregnant with an illegitimate child.
She had four babies, all dogs.
The family was ashamed.
They moved her so that she would live alone.
She lived there alone with her babies, the dogs.
There was just one that looked after her; her uncle used to go see her and bring her food.
The dogs grew up.
The mother went down to the beach to dig clams.
Before long she started hearing someone singing.
“Maybe I will go see,” she said.
Whenever she got close to her house, the ones who were singing would all get quiet.
She got a plan. She put her stick in the sand and threw her cape over it.
She snuck up and looked into her house.
There they were all naked, stripped of their fur, singing and dancing around.

utterances.transcript: nuuknaakʔaɬ.          ƛ̓aḥʔee,        ƛ̓aḥʔee         ʔiqismoo                  č̓iitaa             ʔumʔee, ƛ̓aḥʔee,        wawaaʔak.
utterances.translation: They were all singing, “Don’t cry. Don’t cry. Your mother is still on the beach digging clams. Don’t cry.” That was how their song went.
They were singing to the youngest brother, the cry baby.

utterances.transcript: kamatqʷiiʔiƛ            ʔumʔiiqsuʔi   sukʷiƛ   hapumy̓amumʔi   t̓iʔuup                    ʔinkʷiɬʔi.
utterances.translation: The mother ran inside, picked up the furs, and threw them in the fire.
The mother got something precious — boys [instead of dogs].
They grew up. They were a truly extraordinary bunch.
One of them started to make a rope. He was going to hunt for a whale.
He laid the rope on the beach.
The tide came in the evening. They then went to sleep.
Next day they looked down on the beach.
There on the beach was a whale.
They were all excited and went down on the beach.

utterances.transcript: čuu qʷisʔaqƛin    hašiiy̓ap              masčumʔakqin           yaʕatqin             wimaʕinʔap̓at,          waanaak̓aƛ.
utterances.translation: “OK, how can we let our tribe, who did not want us, know about this,” said one of them.
One of them cut off a piece of the skin and blubber.
He threw up the skin. Nothing happened.
At the fourth time he threw it up, and it flew, turning into a bird.
He (the boy) put a piece of blubber in its mouth.

utterances.transcript: čaʔaaɬči   ʔucaḥtačiƛ         ḥuu        matšiƛ,   waaʔaƛ     ʔuḥtaa      maamaatiʔi,  ʔuuwaƛ̓aqƛ̓ick         ɬuucma hiɬn̓iis                         ʕiḥak.  t̓iwaʕaqisʔap̓um                                  ʔaḥ  ƛ̓aaqʔii,       ʔaḥʔaaʔaƛsuuk   huʔacačiƛ      matšiƛ.
utterances.translation: He told the bird, “Go fly over that way. You will see a woman on the beach crying. Drop this blubber beside her. Then you will fly back to us.”

utterances.transcript: t̓aaqaak matšiƛ  maamaatiʔi.  hinasiƛ               qʷisʔaƛ      waaʔanitʔitq         t̓iwaʕaqsan̓ap                       ʕiḥakyaqisʔi                  ɬuucma ƛ̓aaqʔii.       huʔacačiƛ      matšiƛ.
utterances.translation: The bird did as told: it flew away; it reached there [the place it was supposed to go] and did what it was told to to — it dropped the blubber beside the crying woman. It flew back.

utterances.transcript: n̓ačiisʔaƛ              ɬuucmaʔi   ʔan  ʔucaḥtačiƛ              qʷicaʔamitʔitqʔaɬ                      ʕiɬčnaakšiƛitʔi.
utterances.translation: The lady followed it with the eyes. It headed for the place that they had put the girl who gave birth to dogs.
She ran home with the news.
The uncle went to look.

utterances.transcript: wik qiikʷaaɬ.       ʔuyaqḥnak   huʔin,    taʔisukʔišʔaɬ                       maaʔak.
utterances.translation: He wasn’t gone long. He came back with news that a whale had drifted on the beach.
The tribe rushed to get prepared, packing their belongings. They were going tback to the place.
They started out.
Before long they saw the place where the one who got dogs lived.
Something happened to the weather.
It got really stormy, and they never reached there.
They all drowned in the stormy sea.

utterances.transcript: ḥaaḥuupay̓ak            — ʔunw̓iiƛḥʔatwaʔiš            wiiy̓aat     ɬaakʷiiɬʔat            yaaʕaaɬčiqḥʔatʔitq               quuʔas. ḥaʔukʷiƛ̓aaɬ           n̓aas.
utterances.translation: Lecture — This is the reason you never treat your fellowmen badly. You get it back from someone up there.
